<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 154, 245, 160]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[164, 180, 245, 193]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[164, 214, 245, 227]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 254, 455, 272]]<|/det|> One fifth of the people are professors. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 272, 411, 288]]<|/det|> \(30 \%\) of the people are part-time. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 302, 496, 319]]<|/det|> Work out the number of full-time lecturers. <|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|> (b) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 410, 366, 426]]<|/det|> (b) \(\mathcal{C}=\{\text { children in a school}\}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 427, 385, 442]]<|/det|> \(F=\{\text { children who like fruit}\}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 441, 435, 458]]<|/det|> \(V=\{\text { children who like vegetables}\}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 468, 529, 483]]<|/det|> 24 children like vegetables but do not like fruit. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 483, 576, 499]]<|/det|> 8 children do not like fruit and do not like vegetables. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 497, 269, 514]]<|/det|> \(\mathrm{n}\left(F \cap V\right)=9\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 515, 289, 532]]<|/det|> \(\mathrm{n}(F)=3 \times \mathrm{n}(V)\) <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[310, 542, 689, 696]]<|/det|> <|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 400, 400, 400]]<|/det|> (i) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 712, 421, 729]]<|/det|> (i) Complete the Venn diagram. <|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 400, 400, 400]]<|/det|> (ii) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 743, 361, 760]]<|/det|> (ii) Work out \(\mathrm{n}(F \cup V)\).
